Description: Rim fragment of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; white slip; hooked meander frieze on the rim; on outer floor animal frieze with dappled goat, grazing to right, preserved; further frieze to centre with part of an animal perhaps preserved. Exterior has brown lines and part of a star on white ground.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 215, no. 44)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102, pl. XXX, no. 308.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.784)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5954 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
